I'm glad you liked the one-pot pasta idea! Now, let's talk about desserts! It's great that you're looking for healthy dessert options that won't ruin your diet. Here are 5 healthy dessert ideas that are easy to make and will satisfy your sweet tooth:

**1.** **Fresh Fruit Salad**: Cut up a variety of fresh fruits (e.g., strawberries, blueberries, grapes, pineapple) and mix them together in a bowl. You can add a splash of lime juice and a bit of honey for extra flavor.

**2.** **Dark Chocolate-Dipped Fruit**: Dip fresh or dried fruits (e.g., strawberries, bananas, cranberries) in melted dark chocolate (at least 70% cocoa) for a sweet and indulgent treat.

**3.** **No-Bake Energy Bites**: Mix rolled oats, nuts (e.g., almonds, walnuts), seeds (e.g., chia, flax), and dried fruits (e.g., cranberries, raisins) with a bit of honey and nut butter (e.g., peanut butter). Roll into balls and refrigerate until firm.

**4.** **Greek Yogurt Parfait**: Layer Greek yogurt, fresh berries, and granola in a bowl. You can also add a drizzle of honey or a sprinkle of cinnamon for extra flavor.

**5.** **Baked Apples**: Core some apples and fill them with cinnamon, nutmeg, and a drizzle of honey. Bake in the oven until tender and caramelized.

These healthy dessert ideas will help you curb your cookie and coffee cravings at work. Plus, they're easy to make and packed with nutrients!

Remember, moderation is key when it comes to desserts. Enjoy these treats in limited portions and savor every bite!

Do you have any other questions or would you like more healthy dessert ideas?
